The comments in this thread astound me.

Let's recap the reasoning behind the changes shall we? The ADC role had virtually no class subset before patch 5.22. The strongest ADCs were - simply put - the ones who were the best Period. There wasn't a whole lot of strategic choice in the matter. Can your ADC deal an insane amount of damage in the shortest amount of time while having a modicum of safety? Great! This is why there was always a holy trinity of ADCs since the game was released. Once upon a time, that was Cait, Ez, Corki; during this year's worlds it was Trist, Kalista and Jinx. You never picked an ADC to accommodate a certain playstyle or team composition because their ability to influence different matchups was basically non-existent. By contrast, you have a great variety of characters you can choose midlane, assassins, pokers, control mages, AP and AD... the list goes on. Riot explained many times over that they wanted to bring strategic diversity into the mix while making sure that a match can't be decided at champ-select. 

Now let's talk about Quinn and why she needed a change. Quinn has had a historically abysmal career in LoL. Her pick-rate hovered between 0.5 and 1%, her winrate was in the mid 40% and she was marred by AA bugs since her release. Quinn's strengths were always determined by two things; her ability to duel and mobility. Being that she is a Demacian scout, it makes sense that a great deal of her power budget would be stored in her traversal skills. In case you haven't been around long enough to see the days when Kass, TF, Panth, Shen, Rammus, Hecarim, Shyvanna or (more recently) teleport were powerful then let me spell it out for you; the ability to quickly re-position your character across the map is a very powerful ability. To compensate for that amped-up power, Riot decided to remove her blind, that being said Quinn is still very bursty with Harrier, and very hard to skirmish against. In fact, bar Vayne I don't really know if there's another ADC that has better dueling potential.

So no, Quinn is not bad, and she has never been a good pick botlane over other ADCs. Seriously, bring her top lane and watch as _Riven _ continually fails to catch you, cries "OP", and watches you gank her allies as she hopelessly tries to catch up on farm. Quinn hilariously counters melee, it's insane.

I predict Quinn will soon be FotM. She was always pretty bursty early game, and now she gets an extra harrier activation off of Q. Her only problem right now is still how buggy harrier is -- or more accurately how slow Valor is to mark targets. It's extremely easy to miss procs between her Passive > E > Q combo because the mark doesn't "take" as soon as Valor flies in, it takes an extra little bit before you can proc it. It is extremely annoying and should have been fixed awhile ago.
